solution_line_template: Last week, she earned a total of ${earnings_per_day} x {days_in_a_week} = $<<{earnings_per_day}*{days_in_a_week}={total_earnings_last_week}>>{total_earnings_last_week}.
While she spent ${total_earnings_last_week} x {skincare_fraction} = $<<{total_earnings_last_week}*{skincare_fraction}={spent_on_skincare}>>{spent_on_skincare} on her skincare products.
Thus, she spent a total of ${spent_on_makeup} + ${spent_on_skincare} = $<<{spent_on_makeup}+{spent_on_skincare}={total_spent}>>{total_spent} from her earnings.
Therefore, Susie is left with ${total_earnings_last_week} - ${total_spent} = $<<{total_earnings_last_week}-{total_spent}={money_left}>>{money_left} from her earnings last week.
